title: Dua Lipa puts on a racy display in a yellow cut-out bodysuit for new single Don't Start Now
text:
She will launch her new single Don't Start Now next month, which is about 'moving on' and entering a new era with a Nu Disco dance track.

And Dua Lipa teased a hint of what's in store as she shared a 22 second clip on her You Tube on Wednesday.

The singer, 24, put on a sizzling display as she writhed around in a yellow cut-out bodysuit which showed off toned abs and peachy derriere.

Wow factor: Dua Lipa put on a sizzling display as she writhed around in a yellow cut-out bodysuit in a teaser of her new music video for Don't Start Now

With her blonde locks swept over in a side parting, the One Kiss hitmaker oozed confidence as she seductively lay on the floor while her new track played in the background.

She said: 'I chose to put this song out first so I could close one chapter of my life and start another.

'Into a new era with a new sound, it’s about moving on and not allowing anyone to get in the way of that.

Turning up the heat: The singer writhed around in the racy leotard which showed off toned abs and peachy derriere

'It also felt like a natural first song choice as I made it with the brilliant same crew I made New Rules with.'

Dua embarked on a 'new chapter' in her love life in June, as she started dating model Anwar Hadid, following her split from on/off boyfriend Isaac Carew.

The Electricity singer excited fans on Tuesday by sharing a clip of Don't Start Now. Alongside a video of Dua posing in a chair, she wrote on her social media channels: 'Miss me?'

Turning up the head: With her blonde locks swept over in a side parting, the One Kiss hitmaker oozed confidence as she seductively lay on the floor

The next chapter: Dua recently said her new single is about 'moving on' and entering a new era

Earlier this month, Dua teased she is heralding a 'new era' with her second album.

The Hotter Than Hell singer has been working on the follow-up to her self-titled debut record, which was released in 2017, for several months and she's been dying her hair different colours to signify the beginning of "DL2".

She shared three selfies of her new look and wrote on her social media accounts: 'A new era! Thank you for your patience. See you soon #DL2 (sic)'

Dua recently promised the whole of her new album will be 'a party'.

She said: 'I feel like you could dance through the whole record. There's lots of nostalgic elements to it.

'There's a sample in there from the 1930s. It's just a party.'

Dua also said she doesn’t consider her change of direction to be 'risky'.

She added: 'It would probably be risky if I wasn't risky with the next record. I don't think it would be as fun if I tried to recreate the first record.

'As an artist, you constantly want to grow and change your perspective and try something new.'
description: The singer, 24, sizzles as she writhed around in a yellow cut-out bodysuit which showed off toned abs and peachy derriere in a 22-second teaser of her new single Don't Start Now on Wednesday.
